verses.plain: But Job answered and said,

tokens.t: But Job answered and said,

verses.plain: Oh that my grief were throughly weighed, and my calamity laid in the balances together!

tokens.t: Oh that my grief were throughly weighed, and my calamity laid in the balances together!

verses.plain: For now it would be heavier than the sand of the sea: therefore my words are swallowed up.

tokens.t: For now it would be heavier than the sand of the sea: therefore my words are swallowed up.

verses.plain: For the arrows of the Almighty are within me, the poison whereof drinketh up my spirit: the terrors of God do set themselves in array against me.

tokens.t: For the arrows of the Almighty
within me, the poison whereof drinketh up my spirit: the terrors of God do set themselves in array against me.

verses.plain: Doth the wild ass bray when he hath grass? or loweth the ox over his fodder?

tokens.t: Doth the wild ass bray when he hath grass? or loweth the ox over his fodder?

verses.plain: Can that which is unsavoury be eaten without salt? or is there any taste in the white of an egg?

tokens.t: Can that which is unsavoury be eaten without salt? or is there
taste in the white of an egg?

verses.plain: The things that my soul refused to touch are as my sorrowful meat.

tokens.t: The things
my soul refused to touch
as my sorrowful meat.

verses.plain: Oh that I might have my request; and that God would grant me the thing that I long for!

tokens.t: Oh that I might have my request; and that God would grant
the thing that I long for!

verses.plain: Even that it would please God to destroy me; that he would let loose his hand, and cut me off!

tokens.t: Even that it would please God to destroy me; that he would let loose his hand, and cut me off!

verses.plain: Then should I yet have comfort; yea, I would harden myself in sorrow: let him not spare; for I have not concealed the words of the Holy One.

tokens.t: Then should I yet have comfort; yea, I would harden myself in sorrow: let him not spare; for I have not concealed the words of the Holy One.

verses.plain: What is my strength, that I should hope? and what is mine end, that I should prolong my life?

tokens.t: What
my strength, that I should hope? and what
mine end, that I should prolong my life?

verses.plain: Is my strength the strength of stones? or is my flesh of brass?

tokens.t: my strength the strength of stones? or
my flesh of brass?

verses.plain: Is not my help in me? and is wisdom driven quite from me?

tokens.t: not my help in me? and is wisdom driven quite from me?

verses.plain: To him that is afflicted pity should be shewed from his friend; but he forsaketh the fear of the Almighty.

tokens.t: To him that is afflicted pity
from his friend; but he forsaketh the fear of the Almighty.

verses.plain: My brethren have dealt deceitfully as a brook, and as the stream of brooks they pass away;

tokens.t: My brethren have dealt deceitfully as a brook,
as the stream of brooks they pass away;

verses.plain: Which are blackish by reason of the ice, and wherein the snow is hid:

tokens.t: Which are blackish by reason of the ice,
wherein the snow is hid:

verses.plain: What time they wax warm, they vanish: when it is hot, they are consumed out of their place.

tokens.t: What time they wax warm, they vanish: when it is hot, they are consumed out of their place.

verses.plain: The paths of their way are turned aside; they go to nothing, and perish.

tokens.t: The paths of their way are turned aside; they go to nothing, and perish.

verses.plain: The troops of Tema looked, the companies of Sheba waited for them.

tokens.t: The troops of Tema looked, the companies of Sheba waited for them.

verses.plain: They were confounded because they had hoped; they came thither, and were ashamed.

tokens.t: They were confounded because they had hoped; they came thither, and were ashamed.

verses.plain: For now ye are nothing; ye see my casting down, and are afraid.

tokens.t: For now ye are nothing; ye see
casting down, and are afraid.

verses.plain: Did I say, Bring unto me? or, Give a reward for me of your substance?

tokens.t: Did I say, Bring unto me? or, Give a reward for me of your substance?

verses.plain: Or, Deliver me from the enemy’s hand? or, Redeem me from the hand of the mighty?

tokens.t: Or, Deliver me from the enemy’s hand? or, Redeem me from the hand of the mighty?

verses.plain: Teach me, and I will hold my tongue: and cause me to understand wherein I have erred.

tokens.t: Teach me, and I will hold my tongue: and cause me to understand wherein I have erred.

verses.plain: How forcible are right words! but what doth your arguing reprove?

tokens.t: How forcible are right words! but what doth your arguing reprove?

verses.plain: Do ye imagine to reprove words, and the speeches of one that is desperate, which are as wind?

tokens.t: Do ye imagine to reprove words, and the speeches of one that is desperate,
as wind?

verses.plain: Yea, ye overwhelm the fatherless, and ye dig a pit for your friend.

tokens.t: Yea, ye overwhelm the fatherless, and ye dig
for your friend.

verses.plain: Now therefore be content, look upon me; for it is evident unto you if I lie.

tokens.t: Now therefore be content, look upon me; for
evident unto you if I lie.

verses.plain: Return, I pray you, let it not be iniquity; yea, return again, my righteousness is in it.

tokens.t: Return, I pray you, let it not be iniquity; yea, return again, my righteousness
in it.

verses.plain: Is there iniquity in my tongue? cannot my taste discern perverse things?

tokens.t: Is there iniquity in my tongue? cannot my taste discern perverse things?

footnotes.text: my words…: that is, I want words to express my grief
when…: Heb. in the heat thereof
ye are…: or, ye are like to them: Heb. to it
ye overwhelm: Heb. ye cause to fall upon
in it: that is, in this matter
